column4: hello also another thing ... installation never prompt me for the root pwd... what is my root pwd
but when i do sudo ... something ... it'll still ask me for pwd
OK, go on System Tools on the left
Then quit Alacarte and go in Applications>System Tools>Configuration Editor
There should be.... You could try launching it manually with "gconfeditor"
I actualy found it, enabled it and ran it... now what .. i can't see anything about making shortcuts
(I think it is desktop, maybe something different, but still obvious)
what is this Configuration Editor ... is it kinda like registry in Win
A bit, but it is only for GNOME programs, so nothing system level is stored there
Most of it can be changed with preferences dialogs, especially if you install gtweakui package
jikanter: so kde doesn't have the same thing
